New Records: Luis Suárez scored his 69th international goal
Key Match Events: Ismaël Koné scored with an acrobatic scissor kick to level the scores
Jonathan David pounced to slot home the rebound
Luis Suárez timed his run perfectly to get on the end of a José María Giménez cross and score his 69th international goal
Post-Match Reflections: Uruguay manager Marcelo Bielsa accuses the Copa América organizers of lying multiple times throughout the tournament
Canada, who hired American Jesse Marsch as coach in May, will consider the tournament one of their best performances since winning the 2000 Concacaf Gold Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on the same field where Uruguay players entered the stands and fought with Colombia fans following a 1-0 semifinal loss on Wednesday night
The attendance was 24,386, compared to more than 70,000 on Wednesday night
Argentina and Uruguay are tied for the most Copa titles with 15 each
Others: Uruguay won the shootout 4-3, with Federico Valverde, Rodrigo Bentancur, Giorgian de Arrascaeta and Luis Suárez converting Uruguay's attempts past goalkeeper Dayne St. Clair
